title: Use-After-Free in nft_trans_elem_destroy
concept: If `nft_trans_elem_destroy` is called on a transaction that has already been committed or aborted improperly, it might access freed memory.
description: In `nft_trans_elem_destroy`, if `te->set` has been freed (e.g. by `nft_set_destroy` in the same batch), accessing `te->set` could be UAF. However, transactions hold a reference to the set.

title: Integer Overflow in nft_set_maxsize
concept: Integer overflow in `nft_set_maxsize` calculation could allow bypassing set size limits.
description: `nft_set_maxsize` calculates `set->size + set->ndeact`. `check_add_overflow` is used. Logic seems robust.

title: Double Free in nft_commit_release
description: `nft_commit_release` frees resources based on `msg_type`. If `nft_trans_destroy` was already called, this would be bad. However, `nft_trans_destroy` is called on error paths before commit. Commit list processing removes them.

title: Race condition in nft_chain_validate
concept: Validating chain while it is being modified.
description: Validation happens under `commit_mutex` or RCU? `nft_chain_validate` iterates rules. If RCU, rules might disappear. It uses `list_for_each_entry` (not RCU safe variant?). It assumes `commit_mutex` held? Yes, called from `nf_tables_validate` which is called from `nf_tables_commit` under mutex.

title: Use-After-Free in nft_flow_rule_create
concept: Using rule after free in error path.
description: If `nft_flow_rule_create` fails, `nft_trans_destroy` is called. `nft_delrule` logic seems correct.

title: Integer Overflow in nft_set_desc_concat
description: Loops summing lengths. `klen` is u32? `len` is u32. Checks `if (len != desc->klen)`. If sum overflows u32 but matches `desc->klen` (which also wrapped?) `nft_set_desc_parse` parses `klen` from netlink. If netlink provided wrapped value? `len` is accumulated. If it wraps, `len` is small. If `desc->klen` is also small, match. But `desc->klen` comes from `NFTA_SET_KEY_LEN`. Userspace controls both. However, `num_regs` check `DIV_ROUND_UP(desc->klen, 4) > NFT_REG32_COUNT` limits `klen` to small value. Overflow unlikely.

title: Memory Leak in nf_tables_newtable error path
concept: Leaking table if transaction adds fail.
description: Allocates table. If `nft_trans_table_add` fails, frees everything. Safe.

title: Use-After-Free in nft_trans_gc_work
description: GC work holds reference to set? `nft_trans_gc_alloc` does `refcount_inc(&set->refs)`. Safe.

title: Double unlock in nf_tables_commit
description: If list empty, unlocks and returns. At end, unlocks. Safe.

title: Use-After-Free in nft_setelem_insert
description: If insert fails, `nf_tables_set_elem_destroy` is called. Function returns error. Caller frees transaction. Safe.

title: nf_tables_abort recursion
description: Iterates list. Calls `nf_tables_abort_release`. No obvious recursion.

title: nft_request_module format string
concept: Format string injection in module name.
description: `vsnprintf` limits length. `module_name` buffer is fixed size. User input is validated (e.g. valid family).

title: nf_tables_newchain duplicate
description: Lookup returns existing. Checks `NLM_F_EXCL`. Returns -EEXIST. Safe.

title: nf_tables_delchain recursion
description: Checks `use` count. If > 0, returns -EBUSY. No recursion. Safe.

title: nft_verdict_init OOB
description: Switch on code. Default returns -EINVAL. Safe.

title: nft_set_lookup_global permission
description: Requires table context. Lookup verifies table match. Safe.

title: nft_data_hold verdict
description: Increments chain use count for jumps. Safe.

title: Double Deactivation in nft_delset
description: Checks `nft_is_active_next`. If not, returns error or ignores. Safe.

title: Use-After-Free in nft_commit_release (net)
description: `put_net` called at end. Transactions hold ref? `nft_trans_alloc` sets `trans->net`. `nft_commit_release` calls `put_net(trans->net)` if `trans->put_net` is true. `nf_tables_commit_release` sets `put_net = true` for last trans. `get_net` called there. Safe.

title: nft_flowtable_type_get module load
description: `nft_request_module` uses `GFP_KERNEL`? Checks lockdep not held. Safe.

title: nft_unregister_flowtable_net_hooks use-after-free
description: Called during commit/abort. Flowtable freed later. Safe.

title: nf_tables_bind_chain loop
description: Checks `!nft_chain_binding(chain)`. A chain can't be bound to itself if it's already bound? Logic prevents loops.

title: nft_set_desc_concat overflow
description: `len += round_up(...)`. `len` is u32. Can overflow? `desc->klen` is u32. If len wraps, might match klen. But `field_count` limited to `NFT_REG32_COUNT`? No, `NFTA_SET_FIELD_MAX`. `NFT_REG32_COUNT` used to limit registers. `if (num_regs > NFT_REG32_COUNT) return -E2BIG`. Limits total length. Safe.

title: nft_set_is_same check
description: Checks ktype, dtype, flags, klen, dlen, field_count, field_len. Robust.

title: nf_tables_newchain duplicate id
description: ID unique per transaction? No, user supplied? If `NFTA_CHAIN_ID` supplied, checked? `nft_chain_lookup_byid` finds existing. Safe.

title: nft_rule_expr_activate recursion
description: Iterates expressions. Activates. No recursion in `nf_tables_api.c`, potentially in expression ops. Core logic safe.

title: nf_tables_getrule_reset permission
description: Requires `CAP_NET_ADMIN` via netlink policy? `nfnetlink` handles this. Safe.

title: nf_tables_abort empty
description: Warns if list empty? `WARN_ON_ONCE(!list_empty)` checked after clearing. Safe.

title: nft_flowtable_parse_hook priority
description: Accepts u32. Validation in `nft_register_flowtable_net_hooks`? Checked via hook ops. Safe.

title: nf_tables_newgen
description: `NFT_MSG_NEWGEN` is not supported for set (it's a notification). `nf_tables_cb` for `NEWGEN` is NULL? No, `nf_tables_cb` array has `[NFT_MSG_NEWGEN] = {0}`. Safe.

title: nf_tables_getgen permission
description: Exposes PID and gen ID. Low impact. Safe.

title: nft_reg_track_update OOB
description: Calculates `regcount`. Loop uses `dreg`. `dreg` should be validated before call. Callers (e.g., bitwise) check. Safe.

title: nf_tables_exit_net race
description: Uses mutex. Cancels work. Releases tables. Safe.

title: Use-After-Free in nft_setelem_remove
description: Requires finding element first. `nft_setelem_remove` doesn't find, it just removes. Caller must ensure validity. Transactions ensure single removal. Safe.

title: nf_tables_dump_sets memory
description: Fails gracefully? `nf_tables_fill_set` can fail. Returns length. Safe.

title: nf_tables_newrule replace failure
description: Handles error. Rolls back deletion? No, order is: del old, add new. If add fails, old is gone? `nft_delrule` puts transaction. If `nft_trans_rule_add` fails, we must rollback `nft_delrule`? Logic: `err = nft_delrule... trans = nft_trans_rule_add... if (!trans) err = -ENOMEM; goto err_destroy_flow_rule`. `err_destroy_flow_rule` does `nft_rule_expr_deactivate`. Does not restore old rule. This might be an issue, but standard transaction abort should handle it if error propagates? Wait, `nf_tables_newrule` returns error. Commit phase won't happen. Abort phase runs. Abort sees DELRULE for old rule. Abort of DELRULE restores it. Safe.

title: nft_set_alloc_name collision
description: Checks existing names. Generates unique name. Safe.

title: nf_tables_newrule compat
description: Compat handling exists? Not seen in snippet. Probably safe.

title: nf_tables_abort destroy
description: Switch on `msg_type`. Correct destroy functions. Safe.
